TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ComponentChangedEventArgs extends System.EventArgs

Docs.summary: Provides data for the event. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentChangedEventArgs> provides data for a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IComponentChangeService.ComponentChanged> event. The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IComponentChangeService.ComponentChanged> event notifies the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IComponentChangeService> and registered event handlers that a particular component in the currently active document has been changed.
A <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentChangedEventArgs> provides the following information:
- A <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentChangedEventArgs.Component%2A> property that indicates the component that was modified.
- A <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentChangedEventArgs.Member%2A> property that indicates the member that was changed.
- A <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentChangedEventArgs.NewValue%2A> property that indicates the new value of the member.
- An <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentChangedEventArgs.OldValue%2A> property that indicates the old value of the member.
Component designers typically raise the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IComponentChangeService.ComponentChanged> event automatically when components are added, removed, or modified. A <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IComponentChangeService.ComponentChanged> event is not raised during form load and unload because changes at this time are expected. A component designer might raise the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IComponentChangeService.ComponentChanged> event after it changes a property of the component; this ensures that the Properties window will display the updated property.
## Examples The following example demonstrates creating a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentChangedEventArgs>.
[!code-cpp[ComponentChangedEventArgsExample#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ComponentChangedEventArgsExample/CPP/componentchangedeventargsexample.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[ComponentChangedEventArgsExample#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ComponentChangedEventArgsExample/CS/componentchangedeventargsexample.cs#1)] [!code-vb[ComponentChangedEventArgsExample#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ComponentChangedEventArgsExample/VB/componentchangedeventargsexample.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks The designer for a component calls this constructor after it has changed a property of the component. This ensures that the Properties window will display the property's updated value.

Docs.summary: Gets the component that was modified.
Docs.value: An that represents the component that was modified.

Docs.summary: Gets the member that has been changed.
Docs.value: A that indicates the member that has been changed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property can be `null` if the member is unknown.

Docs.summary: Gets the new value of the changed member.
Docs.value: The new value of the changed member. This property can be .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property has meaning only if the member is not `null`.

Docs.summary: Gets the old value of the changed member.
Docs.value: The old value of the changed member. This property can be .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property has meaning only if the member is not `null`.
